'The sacred' - describes the mosque. The Sacred Mosque (Kaaba in Makkah)! Complete: disbelief and (preventing worship at) the Sacred Mosque...
'And expelling' or 'expulsion'. From kh-r-j (to exit). Form IV verbal noun: 'making exit' = expelling. Nominative (as coordinated subject). And EXPELLING...
'Ahl' (people/family) + 'hi' (its). Genitive in construct. Its PEOPLE - the people of the Sacred Mosque (Muslims)...
'Min' (from) + 'hu' (it). FROM IT - expelling Muslims from the Sacred Mosque! The Quraysh expelled Muslims from Makkah - this is being condemned!
'Greater' or 'worse'. From k-b-r. Comparative 'afʿal' form. All these sins are GREATER than fighting in sacred month!
'In the sight of' or 'with' - from whose perspective? Allah's!
Allah in genitive. In ALLAH'S sight, these are greater sins! Not in people's sight, but ALLAH'S!
'And the persecution' or 'trial'. From f-t-n (to test/persecute). Nominative. Persecution of believers...
Same word: 'greater'. Persecution is GREATER (worse)...
'Than' - in comparison. Greater THAN...

'The killing' in genitive (after 'min'). Powerful statement: PERSECUTION is worse than killing! Forcing people to abandon their faith is worse than death! This was the Makkans' crime against early Muslims.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَٱلَّذِينَ هَاجَرُوا۟ وَجَـٰهَدُوا۟ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يَرْجُونَ رَحْمَتَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Inna lladhīna āmanū wa-lladhīna hājarū wa-jāhadū fī sabīli llāhi ulāika yarjūna raḥmata llāhi wa-llāhu ghafūrun raḥīmun
verses.translation: Indeed, those who have believed, emigrated, and strived in the way of Allah—those can hope for Allah's mercy. And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

grammar.practical: Emphatic 'indeed' - adds certainty and emphasis to the statement.
Those who - introduces the believers being described.
Form IV past from '-m-n: 'they believed'. First quality: FAITH!
'And those who' - adds second group (same people, different quality).
From h-j-r (to emigrate). Form III: 'they emigrated'. Refers to Hijrah - leaving Makkah for Allah's sake. Second quality: SACRIFICE of homeland!
From j-h-d (to strive). Form III: 'they strived/struggled'. Root of 'jihād'. Third quality: STRIVING in Allah's path!
Preposition 'in' - shows the sphere of their striving.
'The path' or 'way'. In construct: path OF...
Allah in genitive. Complete: 'in Allah's path' - striving for Allah's cause, not worldly gain!
Plural demonstrative: 'Those' - points to the believers described. THOSE specific people with faith, sacrifice, and striving...
From r-j-w (to hope). Third plural present: 'they hope'. They HOPE (with good reason)...
'The mercy' in accusative (object of 'hope'). From r-ḥ-m. In construct: mercy OF...
Allah in genitive. They hope for ALLAH'S MERCY! Beautiful promise: after all their sacrifices, they can HOPE for Allah's mercy!
Allah as subject - describes His attributes.
'All-Forgiving'. From gh-f-r (to forgive). Pattern 'faʿūl' shows intensity. Nominative with tanwīn. Allah is extremely forgiving!

'Most Merciful'. From r-ḥ-m (mercy). Pattern 'faʿīl' shows intensity. Allah is extremely merciful! These two names appear together often: Forgiving (covers past sins) and Merciful (grants future goodness)!

verses.arabic: ۞ يَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلْخَمْرِ وَٱلْمَيْسِرِ ۖ قُلْ فِيهِمَآ إِثْمٌ كَبِيرٌ وَمَنَـٰفِعُ لِلنَّاسِ وَإِثْمُهُمَآ أَكْبَرُ مِن نَّفْعِهِمَا ۗ وَيَسْـَٔلُونَكَ مَاذَا يُنفِقُونَ قُلِ ٱلْعَفْوَ ۗ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ ٱللَّهُ لَكُمُ ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَفَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yas'alūnaka ʿani l-khamri wal-maysiri qul fīhimā ithmun kabīrun wa-manāfiʿu lilnnāsi wa-ithmuhūmā akbaru min nafʿihimā wa-yas'alūnaka mādhā yunfiqūna quli l-ʿafwa kadhālika yubayyinu llāhu lakumu l-āyāti laʿallakum tatafakkarūn
verses.translation: They ask you about intoxicants and gambling. Say: 'There is great evil in both, as well as some benefit for people—but the evil outweighs the benefit.' They also ask what they should donate. Say: 'Whatever you can spare.' This is how Allah makes His revelations clear to you, so perhaps you may reflect.

grammar.practical: They ask you (O Prophet) - seeking Islamic ruling on controversial issues.
About/concerning - introduces the topic.
'Wine' or 'intoxicants' in genitive. From kh-m-r (to cover/ferment). Called 'khamr' because it covers the mind! They ask about alcohol...
'And gambling' in genitive. From y-s-r (to be easy). Gambling seems easy money but leads to ruin! Two vices: intoxicants AND gambling.
Command to Prophet: 'Say!' Here's the answer...
'Fī' (in) + 'himā' (both of them - dual pronoun). In BOTH intoxicants and gambling...
'Sin' from '-th-m. Nominative with tanwīn. There IS sin in both...
'Great' or 'major'. From k-b-r. Nominative with tanwīn. Not just minor sin - GREAT sin!
'And benefits' or 'advantages'. Plural of 'manfaʿah' (benefit). Nominative. Admits there ARE some benefits (medicinal use of alcohol, economic activity in gambling)...
'For the people' - some benefit for people. But here comes the critical point...

words.translation: and their sin / the sin of both

grammar.practical: 'And the sin of both of them'. 'Ithm' + dual pronoun 'humā'. The SIN of both intoxicants and gambling...
'Greater' or 'bigger'. Comparative form. Their sin is GREATER...
'Than' - in comparison. Greater THAN...
'Naf' (benefit) + dual pronoun 'himā'. The BENEFIT of both. Critical verdict: The SIN is GREATER than the BENEFIT! This gradual approach eventually led to complete prohibition.
And they ask you - second question in this verse.
'What' - double interrogative. What should they...?
From n-f-q. Third plural present: 'they spend'. What should they spend (in charity)?
Command: 'Say!' Answer to second question...

words.translation: the surplus / what is extra / what you can spare

grammar.practical: 'The surplus' or 'what is extra'. From ʿ-f-w (to pardon/be surplus). Accusative. Spend THE SURPLUS - what you can spare without causing yourself hardship! Beautiful balance - neither be stingy nor harm yourself!

words.translation: thus / like this / in this way

grammar.practical: 'Thus' or 'like this'. Ka (like) + dhālika (that). In THIS manner, similarly...
From b-y-n (to clarify). Form II intensive: 'He makes very clear'. Third singular present: 'He clarifies'. Allah CLARIFIES...
Allah as subject. ALLAH clarifies (not just anyone - Allah Himself!)...
'For you' - He clarifies FOR YOU (for your benefit)...
'The verses' or 'signs' in accusative. Plural of 'āyah'. He clarifies the VERSES/SIGNS - the guidance!
'Laʿalla' (perhaps/so that) + 'kum' (you). Particle of hope/expectation. So that PERHAPS you...

From f-k-r (to think). Form V intensive: 'to think deeply/reflect'. Second plural present: 'you reflect'. So that you REFLECT and think deeply! The goal: deep reflection on Allah's signs and guidance!

verses.arabic: فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۗ وَيَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلْيَتَـٰمَىٰ ۖ قُلْ إِصْلَاحٌۭ لَّهُمْ خَيْرٌۭ ۖ وَإِن تُخَالِطُوهُمْ فَإِخْوَٰنُكُمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ ٱلْمُفْسِدَ مِنَ ٱلْمُصْلِحِ ۚ وَلَوْ شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَأَعْنَتَكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Fī d-dunyā wal-ākhirati wa-yas'alūnaka ʿani l-yatāmā qul iṣlāḥun lahum khayrun wa-in tukhāliṭūhum fa-ikhwānukum wa-llāhu yaʿlamu l-mufsida mina l-muṣliḥi wa-law shāa llāhu la-aʿnatakum inna llāha ʿazīzun ḥakīmun
verses.translation: Upon this world and the Hereafter. They ask you concerning orphans. Say: 'Improving their condition is best. And if you partner with them, they are your brothers in faith. Allah knows who intends harm from who intends good. Had Allah willed, He could have made it difficult for you. Surely Allah is Almighty, All-Wise.'

grammar.practical: 'In' or 'upon' - continuation from previous verse about reflecting.
'The worldly life' - this present life. Reflect on this world...
'And the Hereafter' - the next life. Reflect on BOTH worlds!
And they ask you - another question to the Prophet.
'About' - concerning what topic?
'The orphans' in genitive. Plural of 'yatīm'. They ask about how to deal with orphans' affairs and property.
Command: 'Say!' The answer...
'Reform' or 'improvement'. From ṣ-l-ḥ (to be good/righteous). Form IV verbal noun: 'making good'. Nominative with tanwīn. IMPROVING their situation...
'For them' - for the orphans. Improvement FOR THEM (putting their interest first)...
'Better' or 'best'. Comparative/superlative form. Doing good for them is BEST!
'And if' - conditional particle. Introduces a condition about mixing affairs.

words.translation: you mix with them / partner with them

grammar.practical: From kh-l-ṭ (to mix). Form III: 'to mix/partner'. Second plural + object pronoun: 'you mix with them'. If you MIX your affairs with theirs (living together, shared expenses, etc.)...

'Fa' (then) + 'ikhwān' (brothers) + 'kum' (your). 'Ikhwān' is plural of 'akh' (brother). Then they are YOUR BROTHERS (in faith) - treat them like family! Beautiful: orphans are your brothers, not strangers!
Allah as subject - Allah knows intentions.
From ʿ-l-m (to know). Third singular present: 'He knows'. Allah KNOWS...
'The corruptor'. From f-s-d. Form IV active participle: 'the one who corrupts'. Accusative. Allah knows the one who CORRUPTS (exploits orphans)...
'From' - distinguishes between two types. Knows the corruptor FROM...

'The reformer' or 'good-doer'. From ṣ-l-ḥ. Form IV active participle: 'the one who does good'. Genitive (after 'min'). Allah knows the corruptor FROM the reformer! Your intentions matter - Allah KNOWS!
'And if' or 'even if' - hypothetical condition. Introduces contrary-to-fact statement.
From sh-y-' (to will). Third singular past: 'He willed'. If Allah HAD willed...
Allah as subject. If ALLAH had willed...

words.translation: He would have burdened you / made it difficult

grammar.practical: 'La' (surely/would have) + 'aʿnata' (He burdened) + 'kum' (you). From ʿ-n-t (to burden/make difficult). Form IV: 'to make difficult'. He would have made it HARD for you (forbidden mixing with orphans entirely)! But He made it easy!
Emphatic: 'Indeed' - emphasizes the following statement.
Allah in accusative (after 'inna'). Indeed ALLAH...
'Almighty' or 'All-Powerful'. From ʿ-z-z. Pattern 'faʿīl'. Allah is Almighty (could have made it difficult)...
'All-Wise'. From ḥ-k-m. Pattern 'faʿīl'. And All-Wise (so He made it easy based on His wisdom)! Together: Allah is Almighty (has power) and All-Wise (uses power wisely)!

verses.arabic: وَلَا تَنكِحُوا۟ ٱلْمُشْرِكَـٰتِ حَتَّىٰ يُؤْمِنَّ ۚ وَلَأَمَةٌ مُّؤْمِنَةٌ خَيْرٌ مِّن مُّشْرِكَةٍ وَلَوْ أَعْجَبَتْكُمْ ۗ وَلَا تُنكِحُوا۟ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ حَتَّىٰ يُؤْمِنُوا۟ ۚ وَلَعَبْدٌ مُّؤْمِنٌ خَيْرٌۭ مِّن مُّشْرِكٍ وَلَوْ أَعْجَبَكُمْ ۗ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يَدْعُونَ إِلَى ٱلنَّارِ ۖ وَٱللَّهُ يَدْعُوٓا۟ إِلَى ٱلْجَنَّةِ وَٱلْمَغْفِرَةِ بِإِذْنِهِۦ ۖ وَيُبَيِّنُ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ لِلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walā tankiḥū l-mushrikāti ḥattā yu'minna wa-la-amatun mu'minatun khayrun min mushrikatin wa-law aʿjabatkum walā tunkiḥū l-mushrikīna ḥattā yu'minū wa-laʿabdun mu'minun khayrun min mushrikin wa-law aʿjabakum ulāika yadʿūna ilā n-nāri wa-llāhu yadʿū ilā l-jannati wal-maghfirati bi-idhnihi wa-yubayyinu āyātihi lin-nāsi laʿallahum yatadhakkarūn
verses.translation: Do not marry polytheistic women until they believe; for a believing slave-woman is better than a free polytheist, even though she may look pleasant to you. And do not give your women to polytheistic men until they believe, for a believing slave-man is better than a free polytheist, even though he may please you. They invite to the Fire, while Allah invites to Paradise and forgiveness by His will. He makes His revelations clear to people so perhaps they may be mindful.

grammar.practical: Prohibition: 'And do not' - introduces strong command against something.
From n-k-ḥ (to marry). Second plural jussive (prohibition): 'do not marry'. Don't marry WHO?
'The polytheist women'. From sh-r-k (to associate partners with Allah). Feminine plural active participle. Women who associate partners with Allah. DO NOT marry them!
'Until' - shows the condition. Until WHEN can you marry them?
From '-m-n. Form IV. Third feminine plural subjunctive: 'they believe'. Until they BELIEVE (accept Islam) - then marriage is allowed!
'And certainly a slave-woman'. 'Amah' = female slave. 'La' is emphatic. CERTAINLY even a slave-woman (who believes)...
'Believing' (feminine). From '-m-n. A slave-woman who BELIEVES...
'Better'. Comparative form. Is BETTER for marriage...
'Than' - comparison word.
'A polytheist woman'. Even if she's free and wealthy. Faith matters MORE than social status!
'Even if' - concessive. Even if a surprising condition is true...

From ʿ-j-b (to please). Form IV: 'to impress'. Past feminine + 'kum': 'she impressed you'. Even if the polytheist woman is beautiful, wealthy, high status - believing slave-woman is BETTER! Faith > Beauty/Status!
Prohibition again - now about men.
Form IV from n-k-ḥ: 'to give in marriage'. Don't give (your women) in marriage to...
'The polytheist men'. Masculine plural. Don't give Muslim women to polytheist men!
'Until' - same structure as before.
Third masculine plural subjunctive: 'they believe'. Until they BELIEVE (accept Islam)!
'And certainly a slave-man'. 'ʿAbd' = male slave. Even a slave-man (who believes)...
'Believing' (masculine). A believing slave-man...
'Better' - for your daughter to marry!
'Than' - comparison.
'A polytheist man'. Even if he's wealthy, handsome, powerful. Believing slave is BETTER!
'Even if' - concessive condition.
Masculine version: 'he impressed you'. Even if polytheist man impresses you, believing slave is better! Why? Explained next...
'Those' - pointing to polytheists. THOSE polytheists...
From d-ʿ-w (to call/invite). Third plural present: 'they invite/call'. They CALL people to...
'To' - destination of their call.
'The Fire' (Hell) in genitive. Polytheists call TO THE FIRE - their disbelief leads to Hell, and they'll take their spouses with them! That's why marriage to them is forbidden!
And ALLAH (in contrast)...
Third singular present: 'He invites'. Allah CALLS people to...
'To' - destination.
'Paradise' in genitive. Allah calls TO PARADISE! Beautiful contrast: polytheists call to Fire, Allah calls to Paradise!
'And forgiveness'. From gh-f-r. Allah calls to Paradise AND forgiveness! Complete blessing!
'By His permission'. From '-dh-n. By ALLAH'S permission - salvation comes only through Allah!
From b-y-n. Form II: 'He makes clear'. Third singular present. And He CLARIFIES...
'His verses' or 'signs'. Plural of 'āyah' + possessive 'hi'. He clarifies HIS verses/signs...
'For the people'. He makes clear FOR PEOPLE (for our benefit)...
'Laʿalla' (perhaps/so that) + 'hum' (they). So that perhaps they...
From dh-k-r (to remember). Form V: 'to remember repeatedly/be mindful'. Third plural present. So that they may REMEMBER and be mindful of Allah's guidance!

verses.arabic: وَيَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلْمَحِيضِ ۖ قُلْ هُوَ أَذًۭى فَٱعْتَزِلُوا۟ ٱلنِّسَآءَ فِى ٱلْمَحِيضِ ۖ وَلَا تَقْرَبُوهُنَّ حَتَّىٰ يَطْهُرْنَ ۖ فَإِذَا تَطَهَّرْنَ فَأْتُوهُنَّ مِنْ حَيْثُ أَمَرَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحِبُّ ٱلتَّوَّٰبِينَ وَيُحِبُّ ٱلۡمُتَطَهِّرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-yas'alūnaka ʿani l-maḥīḍi qul huwa adhan fa-ʿtazilū n-nisāa fī l-maḥīḍi walā taqrabūhunna ḥattā yaṭhurna fa-idhā taṭahharna fa-tūhunna min ḥaythu amarakumu llāhu inna llāha yuḥibbu t-tawwābīna wa-yuḥibbu l-mutaṭahhirīn
verses.translation: They ask you about menstruation. Say: 'Beware of its harm! So keep away, and do not have intercourse with your wives during their monthly cycles until they are purified. When they purify themselves, then you may approach them in the manner specified by Allah. Surely Allah loves those who always turn to Him in repentance and those who purify themselves.'

grammar.practical: They ask you (O Prophet) - about a sensitive private matter.
'About' - concerning the topic.
'Menstruation'. From ḥ-y-ḍ (to menstruate). They ask about Islamic rulings regarding menstruation.
Command: 'Say!' The answer...
Pronoun 'it' - referring to menstruation. It is...
'Harm' or 'discomfort'. From '-dh-y. Accusative with tanwīn. It's a state of discomfort/harm (physical/ritual) - requires special care.
From ʿ-z-l. Form VIII: 'to withdraw/separate'. Command plural: 'keep away!' So KEEP AWAY from...
'The women' or 'wives' in accusative (object). Plural of 'imra'ah' (woman). Keep away from women (sexually)...
'During' or 'in' - specifies when to keep away.
Same word: menstruation. During THE MENSTRUATION - don't have intercourse during this time.
Prohibition: 'And do not' - additional command.
From q-r-b (to be near). Second plural jussive + feminine plural pronoun 'hunna': 'do not approach them'. Don't approach them (sexually)...
'Until' - sets the time limit. Until WHEN?

words.translation: they become pure / they are purified

grammar.practical: From ṭ-h-r (to be pure). Third feminine plural present/subjunctive: 'they become pure'. Until they're PURIFIED (menstruation ends).
'So when' or 'then when' - introduces time condition. When they...
From ṭ-h-r. Form V (reflexive): 'to purify oneself'. Feminine plural past: 'they purified themselves'. When they PURIFY themselves (perform ghusl/bath after menstruation ends)...

words.translation: then approach them / go to them

grammar.practical: From '-t-y (to come/approach). Command plural + feminine pronoun: 'approach them!' THEN you may approach them (sexually).
'From' or 'in' - specifies manner.
'Where' or 'as' or 'in the manner that'. Approach them FROM WHERE/IN THE MANNER that...
From '-m-r (to command). Past + 'kum': 'He commanded you'. In the manner that He COMMANDED you...
Allah as subject. That ALLAH commanded you (in lawful way - proper intercourse, not forbidden acts).
Emphatic: 'Indeed' - emphasizes statement.
Allah in accusative. Indeed ALLAH...
From ḥ-b-b (to love). Third singular present: 'He loves'. Allah LOVES...

'Those who constantly repent'. From t-w-b. Form II pattern (tawwāb) shows intensity/frequency: those who CONSTANTLY turn to Allah in repentance! Masculine plural accusative. Allah loves those who always repent!
And He loves - second category of beloved people.

'Those who purify themselves'. From ṭ-h-r. Form V active participle: those who constantly purify themselves (physically and spiritually). Masculine plural accusative. Allah loves the constantly pure! Beautiful ending: Allah loves repentance (spiritual purity) and physical purity!

verses.arabic: نِسَآؤُكُمْ حَرْثٌۭ لَّكُمْ فَأْتُوا۟ حَرْثَكُمْ أَنَّىٰ شِئْتُمْ ۖ وَقَدِّمُوا۟ لِأَنفُسِكُمْ ۚ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱعۡلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّكُم مُّلَـٰقُوهُ ۗ وَبَشِّرِ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Nisāukum ḥarthun lakum fa-tū ḥarthakum annā shi'tum wa-qaddimū li-anfusikum wa-ttaqū llāha wa-ʿ'lamū annakum mulāqūhu wa-bashshiri l-mu'minīn
verses.translation: Your wives are farmland for you, so approach them consensually as you please. Send forth something good for yourselves. Be mindful of Allah, and know that you will meet Him. Give good news to the believers.

grammar.practical: 'Your wives'. 'Nisā' (women/wives) + 'kum' (your). Nominative (subject). YOUR wives...

'Farmland' or 'cultivation'. From ḥ-r-th (to plow/cultivate). Nominative with tanwīn (predicate). Metaphor: wives are like farmland - place of growth, life, cultivation, producing children/family. Respectful metaphor emphasizing productivity and care!
'For you' - for your benefit, your family line.
From '-t-y. Command plural: 'approach!' So APPROACH (have relations with)...
'Your farmland' - referring to wives metaphorically. Accusative (object).
'How' or 'when' or 'wherever'. Meaning: in whatever lawful manner...
From sh-y-' (to will/wish). Second plural past: 'you wished'. HOW you wish (within lawful bounds - proper intercourse, not forbidden acts). Gives flexibility within Islamic limits!
From q-d-m (to be before/precede). Form II command: 'send forward!' AND send forward (good deeds for the afterlife)...
'Li' (for) + 'anfus' (selves) + 'kum' (your). FOR YOURSELVES - do good deeds for your own benefit in the afterlife!
From w-q-y. Form VIII command: 'have taqwa!' And BE CONSCIOUS OF Allah...
Allah in accusative (object of taqwa). Have taqwa OF ALLAH!
From ʿ-l-m. Command: 'know!' And KNOW with certainty...
'Anna' (that/indeed) + 'kum' (you). That YOU (all)...
'Meeting Him'. Active participle from l-q-y + pronoun 'hu'. You are MEETEERS of Him = you WILL MEET Him (Allah on Judgment Day)! Know you'll face Allah!
From b-sh-r. Form II command: 'give good news!' Addressed to Prophet: And GIVE GOOD NEWS...
'The believers'. From '-m-n. Active participle plural masculine accusative. Give good news TO THE BELIEVERS (of Paradise)!

verses.arabic: وَلَا تَجْعَلُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ عُرْضَةً لِّأَيْمَـٰنِكُمْ أَن تَبَرُّوا۟ وَتَتَّقُوا۟ وَتُصْلِحُوا۟ بَيْنَ ٱلنَّاسِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Walā tajʿalū llāha ʿurḍatan li-aymānikum an tabarrū wa-tattaqū wa-tuṣliḥū bayna n-nāsi wa-llāhu samīʿun ʿalīmun
verses.translation: Do not use Allah's Name in your oaths as an excuse for not doing good, not guarding against evil, or not making peace between people. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

grammar.practical: Prohibition: 'And do not' - introduces prohibition.
From j-ʿ-l (to make/put). Second plural jussive: 'do not make'. Don't MAKE or USE...
Allah in accusative (object). Don't use ALLAH (Allah's name)...
'An obstacle' or 'excuse' or 'target'. From ʿ-r-ḍ (to present/expose). Accusative with tanwīn. Don't make Allah an EXCUSE/obstacle (through your oaths)...
'Li' (for) + 'aymān' (oaths - plural of yamīn) + 'kum' (your). FOR YOUR OATHS - don't use Allah's name in oaths as an excuse to avoid doing good!
'That' or 'to' - introduces purpose clause.

words.translation: you do good / you are righteous

grammar.practical: From b-r-r (to be righteous/do good). Second plural subjunctive: 'you do good'. Don't use oaths as excuse NOT to do good!
From w-q-y. Form VIII subjunctive: 'you have taqwa'. And NOT to have taqwa!
From ṣ-l-ḥ. Form IV subjunctive: 'you make peace'. And NOT to make peace...
'Between' - where to make peace.

'The people'. Between PEOPLE! Complete meaning: Don't swear by Allah and use that oath as excuse to avoid doing good, having taqwa, or making peace between people! Example: someone swears 'By Allah I'll never speak to him!' and uses that oath to refuse reconciliation. This is forbidden!
Allah as subject - His attributes.
'All-Hearing'. From s-m-ʿ (to hear). Pattern 'faʿīl' shows intensity. Allah HEARS all oaths and knows your intentions!
'All-Knowing'. From ʿ-l-m. Pattern 'faʿīl'. Allah KNOWS everything - your intentions, excuses, truth! Can't hide behind oaths!

verses.arabic: لَّا يُؤَاخِذُكُمُ ٱللَّهُ بِٱللَّغْوِ فِىٓ أَيْمَـٰنِكُمْ وَلَـٰكِن يُؤَاخِذُكُم بِمَا كَسَبَتْ قُلُوبُكُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٌ حَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Lā yuākhidhukumu llāhu bil-laghwi fī aymānikum walākin yuākhidhukum bimā kasabat qulūbukum wa-llāhu ghafūrun ḥalīmun
verses.translation: Allah will not hold you accountable for unintentional oaths, but for what you intended in your hearts. And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Forbearing.

grammar.practical: Negation: 'not' - Allah will NOT...

words.translation: He holds you accountable / He takes you to task

grammar.practical: From '-kh-dh. Form III: 'to hold accountable/take to task'. Third singular + 'kum': 'He holds you accountable'. Allah will NOT hold you accountable...
Allah as subject (nominative). ALLAH will not hold you accountable...
'Bi' (for/by) + 'al-laghw' (unintentional speech/idle talk). From l-gh-w (to be vain/useless). For UNINTENTIONAL oaths - casual expressions like 'By Allah!' without real intention to swear.
'In' - specifies sphere.
'Your oaths'. Plural of 'yamīn' + possessive. In YOUR oaths - casual, unintentional oaths are forgiven!
'But' - introduces contrast. BUT (Allah will hold you accountable)...
Same verb: 'He holds you accountable'. BUT He WILL hold you accountable...
'Bi' (for) + 'mā' (what). FOR WHAT...
From k-s-b (to earn/acquire). Feminine past: 'it earned'. What your hearts EARNED/intended...

'Your hearts'. Plural of 'qalb' + possessive. Nominative (subject of 'kasabat'). What YOUR HEARTS earned - your INTENTIONS! Allah holds you accountable for INTENTIONAL oaths and what your heart truly meant!
Allah as subject - His attributes.
'All-Forgiving'. From gh-f-r. Pattern 'faʿūl' shows intensity. Allah forgives unintentional oaths!

'Most Forbearing' or 'Most Patient'. From ḥ-l-m (to be forbearing). Pattern 'faʿīl'. Allah is patient with our mistakes, doesn't rush to punish! Beautiful ending: Allah is Forgiving (covers sins) and Forbearing (doesn't rush to punish) - gives us time to repent! FINAL VERSE COMPLETE - ALL 25 VERSES DONE!
